entries.meaning: (computing, object-oriented programming) A high-level class that passes attributes and methods down the hierarchy to subclasses.
(taxonomy) A taxon ranking below a phylum and above a class.

verbs.description: superclass (third-person singular simple present superclasses, present participle superclassing, simple past and past participle superclassed)

entries.meaning: (transitive, computing, object-oriented programming) To create a superclass of.
examples: Applications incorporating superclassing "clean up" by calling UnregisterClass on all superclassed classes.
